problem: A large triangle is cut into two smaller triangles, $XYZ$ and $ABC$, by a line parallel to one of its sides. If the area of triangle $ABC$ is three times that of triangle $XYZ$, what is the ratio of the length of the side of $ABC$ parallel to the cut to the corresponding side of $XYZ$?
solution: The areas of the triangles are proportional to the square of the ratio of corresponding sides. If the area of $ABC$ is three times that of $XYZ$, then $(\text{ratio of sides})^2 = 3$. Thus, the ratio of the sides is $\sqrt{3}:1 = \boxed{\sqrt{3}}.$
